definition: seat of government/government repository (archive)/official residence/mansion/presidential palace/(honorific) Your home/prefecture (from Tang to Qing times)

sentences.english: There was a mansion on the island, which was connected to an old castle by a passageway.
sentences.chinese: 岛上有座府邸，通过一条过道连向另一座旧城堡。

sentences.english: Body Works is located in Sanlitun near the residence of the international players.
sentences.chinese: 位于工体三里屯附近，国际大腕府邸。

sentences.english: No newfangled lamps had ever made their appearance at Audley Court.
sentences.chinese: 奥德利庄院的府邸里从来不出现时髦的新灯。

sentences.english: She burned all pictures. She set fire to the mansion and the oldcastle.
sentences.chinese: 她烧掉了所有的画，也烧掉了府邸和旧城堡。

sentences.english: When the signals to find locations, is actually found in the Cao house.
sentences.chinese: 当找到信号地点时，居然发现是曹氏府邸。

sentences.english: There was not single place in the mansion she did not paint.
sentences.chinese: 整个府邸没有一处没被她画上。

definition: Imperial City, inner part of Beijing, with the Forbidden City at its center
seat of government/government repository (archive)/official residence/mansion/presidential palace/(honorific) Your home/prefecture (from Tang to Qing times)
